# Government Tender Announcement
## DSSA Fume Hood Certification and Maintenance
### Contract Overview
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing a request for proposal (RFP) for the certification, preventative maintenance, and ad-hoc repair of three constant air volume (CAV) bypass ducted fume hoods within Designated Safe Sampling Areas (DSSA).

### Key Contract Details
* **Solicitation Number**: WS4151727099
* **Tender Closing Date**: February 15, 2024, at 14:00 EST
* **Duration**: One year, with option to extend three additional years
* **Location**: Ville St-Laurent, Quebec; Mississauga, Ontario; and Richmond, British Columbia
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open bidding
* **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price

### Service Scope
The contracted services will include the certification and preventative maintenance of three CAV bypass ducted fume hoods, as well as any ad-hoc repairs that may be required. The fume hoods are an essential piece of equipment for the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) and are used to capture, contain, and exhaust hazardous chemicals and particulates.

### Contracting Entity
The contracting entity for this procurement is the PSPC, and the notice for this RFP can be found on the Ariba Discovery platform.

### Contact Information
For further information or to submit a bid, please contact Chad Bellerdine at the following email address:
[mailto:chad.bellerdine@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca][mailto:chad.bellerdine@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:]

### Important Notes
Please disregard the original Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time, and all bids must be submitted by February 15, 2024, at 14:00 EST. Any bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive. The contract award will be made to the bidder with the lowest price. The contract duration and terms and conditions will be outlined in the solicitation package. Suppliers are encouraged to review the solicitation package and submit their bids accordingly.
